channel.title: Latest Cricket News Today, Live Cricket Score, Match Coverage, ICC Cricket News | Hindustan Times
channel.description: Get all the Latest Cricket News, Live Cricket Score, Match Coverage, Match Analysis, Match Highlights, ICC Cricket Team, Cricket Tournaments and more on Hindustan Times.
channel.copyright: Copyright (C) 2019 HT Media Limited. All Rights Reserved.

image.title: Latest Cricket News Today, Live Cricket Score, Match Coverage, ICC Cricket News | Hindustan Times

item.title: 'Get Kohli out and you'll become the most-hated cricketer. Experienced it bowling to Sachin Tendulkar': Australia bowler
item.description: Picking up the prized wicket of Virat Kohli still remains the ultimate aim for any bowler, which is why if you are as Australian bowler playing the Test series against India, you can't help but prepare tactics against Kohli.

item.title: Prithvi Shaw breaks silence after India batter's 'Wifey' post on Valentine's Day goes viral
item.description: Prithvi Shaw, who enjoys a massive fan following on Instagram, dedicated his special post to model-cum-actress Nidhi Tapadia on the occasion of Valentine's Day.

item.title: 'Rohit Sharma says come at me if you want. I will...': Simon Doull on India captain's 'puffed chest' moment vs Australia
item.description: Reacting to Rohit Sharma's century in the first Test against Australia in which the India captain hit two sixes and 15 fours, scoring 120 at a strike rate of 56, former New Zealand pacer Simon Doull said the right-hander thrives under tough situations.

item.title: 'When India lost in Adelaide...': Ex-IND batter doubts Australia's ability to bounce back after Nagpur humiliation
item.description: The former Indian batter spoke at length about Australia’s chances of making a comeback after the Nagpur humiliation. India crushed Australia by an innings and 132 runs to take a 1-0 lead in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy at Nagpur.

item.title: Pakistan fan's special request to Virat during PSL opener triggers ‘King Kohli’ reactions
item.description: While this was the action on the pitch, an incredible fan moment was also captured on TV, taking no time to go viral on social media.

item.title: 'I call him the beast. But he and Murali Vijay aren't celebrated enough': Ashwin ahead of India star's amazing milestone
item.description: Veteran Indian off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin on Tuesday highlighted the names of two India greats who "aren't celebrated enough", one of whom he calls "the beast" and is slated to complete the milestone of 100 Test appearances for India.

item.title: Border-Gavaskar Trophy: Tickets for India vs Australia 2nd Test in New Delhi 'sold out'
item.description: "The tickets are sold out and we are expecting a full house. There is a lot of interest since a Test match is being played in Delhi after a long time," said DDCA joint secretary Rajan Manchanda

item.title: 'Shami came to me angry, said 'I want to quit cricket'. I immediately took him to Ravi Shastri and...'': Ex-India coach
item.description: Embracing a tumultuous time on the personal front, pacer Mohammed Shami was ready to call time on his cricket career. Former India bowling Bharat Arun has revealed that pacer Shami had a life-changing conversation with ex-Indian head coach Ravi Shastri before the Men In Blue toured England.

item.title: Prithvi Shaw shares picture with 'Wifey' on Valentine's Day, then deletes post
item.description: Prithvi Shaw, who has remained tight-lipped about his love life, and has rather built a mystery around it, for the first time, gave a sneak peak into his personal life, posting a picture with a girl he called his 'Wifey' on his Instagram story.

item.title: 'Say what you want, Australia got smoked and dusted in a manner...': Clark lands heavy blows on Cummins and Co.
item.description: Former Australia fast bowler Stuart Clark said the Pat Cummins-led side's preparation was not up to the mark as they decided against playing practice matches. India beat Australia by an innings and 132 runs in the first Test.

item.title: Watch: Commentators in splits after Shahnawaz Dahani misses schoolboy run-out chance in PSL; Waqar Younis in shock
item.description: Shahnawaz Dahani, who has ample time to collect the ball and inflict a run-out makes a total mess of it during the PSL tie between Lahore Qalandars and Multan Sultan.

item.title: 'There'll be talk about Kohli, Ashwin but he'll set the tone vs AUS': Shastri's 'much like Sehwag' remark on India star
item.description: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri has pointed out that despite the talk around Kohli and Ashwin, an India star, who is "much like Sehwag at his best", will set the tone for India against Australia.

item.title: Gulf Giants beat Desert Vipers to claim inaugural ILT20 title
item.description: It was a pulsating chase to the target cheered by a large Sunday crowd, who created an electrifying atmosphere in the stadium.

item.title: ‘He is ready’: Hasan Ali names Babar Azam's replacement as Pakistan captain
item.description: Babar Azam and Co. endured humiliating series defeats against England and Australia, before playing two draws against New Zealand at home.

item.title: 'They're strong comments...': Border served blunt reply by Australia star for blasting 'ridiculous' Smith act vs India
item.description: Former Australia captain Allan Border has been served with a blunt reply by an Aussie star for “strong comments” on Steve Smith as he shrugged off the criticism aimed at the team.

item.title: 'They either shoot themselves in the foot and say 'we made a mistake'...': Clarke identifies AUS' dreadful India reality
item.description: Former Australia captain Michael Clarke feels the tourists have managed to corner themselves with their selection moves in the first Test as he identified a dreadful reality for the Pat Cummins-led side.

item.title: Watch: Scary scenes at PSL 2023 match as floodlight tower catches fire due to opening-ceremony mishap
item.description: The 2023 PSL opener - Multan Sultans versus Lahore Qalandars - was delayed by about 30 minutes after a mishap owing to the fireworks during the opening ceremony led to a chaos. One of the floodlights had caught fire.

item.title: Kyle Jamieson, Matt Henry withdrawn from New Zealand squad to face England
item.description: New Zealand have called up uncapped duo Jacob Duffy (Otago Volts) and Scott Kuggeleijn (Northern Districts) for the opener - only the second day-night test they have hosted.

item.title: 'Rohit Sharma is not celebrated enough...': Dinesh Karthik's monumental remark about IND captain before 2nd Test vs AUS
item.description: Reflecting on Rohit Sharma's batting masterclass in the Nagpur Test, Indian wicketkeeper Dinesh Karthik highlighted the phenomenal batting record of the star opener in India.

item.title: IND vs AUS: After Jaydev Unadkat, another India star likely to miss Delhi Test
item.description: With the second Test scheduled for Friday, there are high chances of India missing out on the services of a second player from the squad.

item.title: 'When BCCI's ACU asked me, I said...': IND pacer recalls match-fixing allegations on Shami by estranged wife Hasin Jahan
item.description: Like any other professional athlete, Shami's career also went through ups and downs, although for the veteran pacer, it was more an off-the-field matter that troubled him. Back in 2018, his estranged wife Hasin Jahan had levelled various allegations, including of match-fixing, resulting in BCCI's Anti-Corruption Unit (ACU) investigating into the matter.

item.title: 'Sachin Tendulkar was deeply unhappy when I joined the team. MS Dhoni meanwhile...': Ex-India coach's stirring details
item.description: Having walked into the side in late 2007, the year when they had suffered a humiliating ODI World Cup exit, the former India coach sensed an air of 'unhappiness' in the dressing room before revealing why MS Dhoni, among them, was a 'standout'.

item.title: Alice Capsey's quickfire 51 sets up England's 4-wicket win over Ireland in Women's T20 World Cup
item.description: Top-order batter Alice Capsey smashed a stunning 22-ball 51 to steer England to a four-wicket win over neighbours Ireland in their Women's T20 World Cup group match here on Monday.

item.title: WPL: Women cricketers bask in the big buy
item.description: WPL auction sees 20 players bought by five franchises for ₹1 crore or more with Smriti Mandhana ( ₹3.4 crore) topping the list

item.title: WPL auctions: Catch ‘em young, mantra of the teams
item.description: The inaugural player auction saw the five franchises also focus on the U-19 and uncapped domestic players along with the India stars

item.title: Ashwin-Jadeja: The dream partnership
item.description: Since 2013, India have never suffered a series defeat at home and the two spinners have more than played their role.

item.title: 'More than Babar Azam's salary': RCB's insane spending on Smriti Mandhana, Ellyse Perry at WPL auction sparks meme fest
item.description: Roped in by the Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) during the marquee set of the Women's Premier League (WPL) 2023 auction, Smriti Mandhana hogged the limelight by joining the Bangalore-based franchise for a whopping sum of ₹3.40 crore on Monday. RCB also opted to break the bank by signing Australia's Ellyse Perry at the auction.

item.title: Watch - ‘Who told that I frequently upload TikTok videos?’: Umar Akmal lashes at reporter, says ‘It would be better if…’
item.description: The Quetta Gladiators batter lost his cool, when a journalist asked him about his fitness and TikTok videos.

item.title: Watch: Indian Women cricketers' enthusiastic cheering for Renuka as RCB purchase pacer for ₹1.5 cr in WPL Auction 2023
item.description: The India Women's team were enthusiastic while cheering for Renuka Singh, as Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) acquired the pacer for ₹1.5 crore in the WPL Auction 2023.

item.title: Shubman Gill named ICC Men's Player of January
item.description: Shubman Gill was a prolific source of runs throughout the month, most notably in the ODI format, scoring big against both Sri Lanka and New Zealand.

item.title: Watch: Mumbai Indians share unseen reaction of Team India stars after signing Harmanpreet for ₹1.8 cr at WPL Auction
item.description: Mumbai Indians have shared an unseen video of the Indian women's team players celebrating the signing of India captain Harmanpreet Kaur at the Women's Premier League (WPL) auction on Monday.

item.title: Move to open in Test saved Rohit’s career: AUS legend makes bold claim, says ‘captaincy played big part in his revival’
item.description: The former Australian player made a bold claim regarding Rohit, stating the move to promote himself in the opening slot “saved his Test career”.

item.title: WPL Auctions: Richa Ghosh most expensive among Indian wicketkeepers, sold to RCB for 1.90 crore
item.description: Listed under the base price of ₹50 lakh, Delhi and Bangalore tussled to acquire the services of the star wicketkeeper-batter.

item.title: Smriti Mandhana to captain in WPL 2023? Mike Hesson drops massive hint after RCB purchase opener for ₹3.4 crore
item.description: RCB purchased Smriti Mandhana during the WPL Auction 2023, and the franchise's director of cricket Mike Hesson dropped a massive hint about a possible captaincy role for the India opener.

item.title: Watch: Mandhana's priceless reaction after striking gold in WPL Auction; IND stars join in celebration with 'RCB' chants
item.description: The household names of superstar batter Smriti Mandhana and Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur were drawn in the first set of the Women's Premier League auction. Mandhana has joined Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) for a whopping sum of INR 3.4 crore at the auction.

item.title: Shafali and Jemimah spark intense bidding war as Delhi Capitals come out on top with mega bids at WPL Auction 2023
item.description: The WPL Auction 2023 saw Delhi Capitals break the bank for Shafali Verma and Jemimah Rodrigues. The franchise won intense bidding wars, to acquire both India stars.

item.title: Who is Mallika Sagar, the auctioneer of the inaugural WPL Auction 2023
item.description: Auctioning high profile sports event is not new for Mallika, having previously conducted the auctions of the Pro Kabaddi League

item.title: Former England captain Eoin Morgan retires from all forms of cricket
item.description: Former white-ball captain Morgan, who bowed out of the international game last June, led England to 50-over World Cup glory on home soil and the top of the one-day and Twenty20 rankings.

item.title: WPL Auction 2023: Mandhana, Harmanpreet strike it rich, join Royal Challengers Bangalore and Mumbai Indians respectively
item.description: Mandhana was roped in by RCB for INR 3.4 crore. The Indian captain, Harmanpreet Kaur, on the other hand, joined Mumbai Indians, for INR 1.8 crore.

item.title: WPL Auction 2023: Full list of sold and unsold players
item.description: WPL 2023 Auction: Get the full list of sold and unsold players during the first-ever auction of the inaugural edition of the Women's Premier League.

item.title: 'Self-destruction...': Dinesh Karthik, Aakash Chopra ridicule Aussie media's 'mind games' over 'Ashwin obsession'
item.description: Dinesh Karthik and Aakash Chopra have lashed out at an Australian media website for their “obsession” over R Ashwin amid the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy series as they highlighted the off-spinner's dominating stat after BCCI announced a change in venue for the third Test between India and Australia

item.title: 'That's where it got murky': Ex-Australia tearaway quick highlights double standards over Warner selection in India Test
item.description: A former Aussie tearaway quick highlighted the double standards over Warner's selection, suggesting a change for the second Test in New Delhi.

item.title: 'Ego hurt ho raha tha': Shami comes up with epic response to Axar's 'told you to show patience' remark after Nagpur Test
item.description: Roped in by Axar Patel for a freewheeling conversation after the Nagpur Test, Mohammed Shami was asked about his batting exploits against Australia in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy opener.

item.title: WPL Auction 2023 Highlights: Smriti Mandhana costliest player at ₹3.4 crore; Harmanpreet, Deepti, Jemimah hit jackpots
item.description: WPL Auction 2023 Highlights: Smriti Mandhana was the most expensive purchase with RCB bagging the India opener for ₹3.4 crore. Meanwhile, Harmanpreet Kaur joined Mumbai for ₹1.8 crore, and Delhi got Jemimah Rodrigues. Catch highlights of the Women's Premier League 2023 auction here.

item.title: Border-Gavaskar Trophy: BCCI names surprise new venue for India vs Australia 3rd Test after Dharamsala boycott
item.description: The third Test match of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series between India and Australia will not be played at the HPCA Stadium in Dharamsala as it has been deemed unfit for action.

item.title: 'They now know the difference...': Mohammad Kaif launches savage 'duplicate Jadeja' dig at Australia ahead of 2nd Test
item.description: While most have taken a swipe at Australia for all the accusations made in the VCA Stadium pitch, India legend Mohammad Kaif launched a savage dig at the tourists with his viral “duplicate Jadeja” tweet.

item.title: 'That’s not good for cricket. ICC needs to step in here': Australia great blasts 'pathetic' India act in Nagpur
item.description: Pat Cummins-led side sought to learn more about Nagpur's VCA Stadium and hence had planned to have a practice session before they left for New Delhi, for the second Test. But their plans scuppered by local curators, leaving Australia great fuming at India's "pathetic" act

item.title: WPL Auction 2023 Live Streaming: When and where to watch Women’s Premier League 2023 Auction live, online and on TV
item.description: The WPL Auction 2023 will be held in Mumbai, on Monday. The auction will see 24 players listed at the highest base price of ₹50 lakh.

item.title: 'Century comeback can be a possibility': Gavaskar sends out huge Virat Kohli warning to Australia ahead of 2nd BGT Test
item.description: Legendary cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has dropped a massive statement about former Indian skipper Virat Kohli. Kohli was dismissed for cheap in the series opener of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy at Nagpur.

item.title: 'One word I use for him is 'Torture'. Even Kohli, Rohit hate playing him in nets'': Karthik on 'unplayable' India bowler
item.description: Team India have one of the best bowling attacks in the world. An example of that was on display on Day 1 and 3 of the opening Test match of Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Nagpur against Australia. But who among them have been toughest bowler for the Indian team?

item.title: Watch: Jemimah Rodrigues' MS Dhoni-like finishing act breaks Pakistan hearts, gives India huge T20 World Cup record
item.description: Jemimah Rodrigues was in red-hot form, smacking back-to-back fours to seal a thrilling win as India beat Pakistan in their Women's T20 World Cup opener.

item.title: ‘Such giant leaps’: Tendulkar, Kohli laud Harmanpreet and Co. after thrilling win vs Pakistan in Women’s T20 WC opener
item.description: Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli lauded Harmanpreet Kaur and Co. after the Indian women's team recorded a famous win over arch-rivals Pakistan in their T20 World Cup campaign opener on Sunday.

item.title: Jemimah steers India to seven-wicket win over Pakistan
item.description: The No 3 batter hit an unbeaten 53 and shared in a 58–run partnership with Richa Ghosh (31*) to ace a tense chase with six balls to spare in their first game of the Women’s ICC T20 World Cup

item.title: Third Test to be moved out of Dharamsala
item.description: Bengaluru, Indore and Rajkot are being explored as possible venues as the ground was deemed unfit for the Test.

item.title: 'World cricket hasn't seen an all-rounder like Jadeja': Ex-PAK star reserves highest of praises for India all-rounder
item.description: Jadeja emerged as one of the standout players from the Indian camp and was also named the Player of the Match for his all-round display.

item.title: Rohit judged the length of virtually every delivery
item.description: The skipper playing late and with soft hands was key on the turning Nagpur pitch and holds lessons for Aussie batters who flopped against Ashwin and Jadeja.

item.title: 'Either Smith or Labuschagne have to...': Sunil Gavaskar makes bold claim after India crush Australia in 1st Test
item.description: Batting legend Sunil Gavaskar has fired a massive warning to Australia after India crushed Pat Cummins and Co. in the 1st Test at Nagpur.
